page.title: 12The Herts Advertiser (contd)
page.content: I analysed a copy of The Herts Advertiser dated June 29th 1985. The newspaper had 56 pages. 15 pages contained general news stories, there were 3 pages of sport, a women's page and a children's page. There were also Letters to the Editor, Births, Deaths and Marriages, TV and Cinema guide, and Entertainments. There were 27 pages of adverts, eg cars for sale, pest control, replacement windscreens, videos, and 4 pages of property for sale (houses, shops etc.). There were 7 pages of job vacancies. The main news stories concerned the activities of animal liberation groups, the centenary of The Herts Advertiser, and Andrea Perkins who had been injured in the coach crash at Ledignan. She had been operated upon in France and had started to improve rapidly.
